group_1.narration: I, Alina, have simply been following my@senso and ispirazione when creating art...
"Yet, with no discernible themes, your art is @a powerful drug that may drive people mad."
If you don't intend to change the world,@stop creating.
After hearing those words,@I realized I had nothing.
Even traveling the world and seeing about @all there is to see didn't fix that.
Over this past month, I haven't changed.
At this rate, my light will burn out before@I even know it.

group_1.textRight: Alina! Where have you been?!
I couldn't get in touch with you at all.@I was really worried!

group_1.textLeft: I just was on vacanza.

group_1.textRight: Vacanza...a vacation?
You were traveling?!

group_1.textLeft: Yes. And no, I didn't buy you a souvenir.

group_1.textRight: Oh...

group_1.textLeft: Anyway, why didn't you clean up the mess@I made with my painting?

group_1.textRight: The teacher said to leave it alone because@you must've had a good reason for doing it.

group_1.textLeft: Now not only is my peer an idiota, but so is@my teacher...
This school's light is burning out too...

group_1.textRight: Are you going to clean it up then?

group_1.textLeft: I don't feel like it. Maybe later.

group_1.textRight: I finished sketching the box! Look, Alina!

group_1.textLeft: Okay, okay...
*Sigh*
Light doesn't follow one straight line.
Multiple light sources create subtle @differences in how shadows appear.
And I've said this before, but you need to@stop drawing objects with lines.
It might be okay for comics, but there are@no such lines in the real world.
Ci fai? Are you with me?

group_1.textRight: Alina...

group_1.textLeft: What?

group_1.textRight: Alina, you aren't drawing anything today...

group_1.textLeft: We're talking about your sketch right now.

group_1.textRight: But you're acting weird... Even before@your trip, you were acting weird!

group_1.textLeft: And?

group_1.textRight: Is it because of that letter last month?

group_1.textLeft: Karin...
When you create art, what theme do you have@in mind?

group_1.textRight: Theme?

group_1.textLeft: Oh, maybe that was too difficult for you to@understand.
Why do you want to draw comics?

group_1.textRight: Will hearing why cheer you up?

group_1.textLeft: I don't know about that.

group_1.textRight: If there's a chance, then I'll tell you!
*Inhale* *Exhale*...
Um...

group_1.textLeft: You don't have to be embarrassed.

group_1.textRight: Um, the reason I draw comics is because...
I want people to read them and feel happy.
Just like how Magical Kirin always cheers me@up.
I want to make comics that bring happiness@to people's lives.

group_1.textLeft: I see...
You want to spread joy.

group_1.textRight: [chara:101201:lipSynch_1]Is that weird?

group_1.textLeft: No...
You may be more of a genius than me.

group_1.textRight: Huh?
No way, you're way more talented than me!
I could never create anything that draws@people in the way your art does!

group_1.textLeft: I'm leaving... Ciao.

group_1.textRight: You're being really weird, Alina!

group_1.textCenter: (Even that ridicola girl possesses what@I lack.)
(A fundamental part of me is missing.)
By nature...all I can produce is poison...
I'm an artist whose light is bound to burn@out at a young age...
